subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Death in the Family "Experiment"!
author: Marlboro63@aol.com
full_text:
-------------------------------1208970732
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="US-ASCII"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

Yes I did when I first started I did not record at all because I was doing  
lengthy box sessions just talking and listening.  it would be a real pain  to 
transcribe over an hours worth of audio.  But the end result justified  the 
means.  I received great contact and communication and the spirits on  the other 
side got to know better.  Better than if I just sat here and  started doing 
5-10 sessions and recording them.  Once they get to know you  it all opens up to 
you.  Good luck.
 
Jeff
 
 
In a message dated 4/23/2008 12:08:12 P.M. Central Daylight Time,  
reesclarke_69@... writes:

 
 
 
I will be recording tonight.  Do you do alot of session without  recording? I 
just wandering.

Marlboro63@...  wrote:  
 
 
Hi Rees,
 
I have done this before in fact just recently.  I did it with my  brother's 
fatherinlaw 2 days after he died.  My technician helped me  out and went and 
got this guy for me and I just about flipped when his voice  actually came over 
the radio.  Unfortunately it did not record.   It was only meant for my ears.
 
Jeff
 
 
In a message dated 4/23/2008 11:58:46 A.M. Central Daylight Time,  
reesclarke_69@In a message date

 
 
 
thank you and it does make very good  sense.

itcdeadpeople  <ITCdeadpeople@ITCdead> wrote:  
 
Hi Rees. When I record, I'll ask for them. I think your views on  the subject 
are wonderful, 
and not in the slightest disrespectful.  

I know for me, when someone makes their transition after having  lived a 
long, full life, it 
isn't as hard for me to deal with  because it's just sad, not tragic (if that 
makes sense.) I 
hope your  great aunt and uncle are enjoying a glorious reunion! :-)  

Margaret

--- In _EVP-ITC@yahoogroupsEVP-_ (mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com) ,  
"reesclarke_,  <reesclarke_reescl>  wrote:
>
> 
> Hello guys, & gals
> 
>  I hope everybody is having a great day, its a beatiful day in the  
> Bluegrass State of Kentucky. I just had a death in my Family,  and I 
> was wandering if anybody does a session today/or tonight  if you could 
> try to get in contact with a Mr. Charlie  Clarke,(my Great Uncle) or 
> Mrs. Joann Clarke(his wife has past  a couple of months ago)to see if 
> you can contact them. If you  do contact him can you tell him that 
> Rees will be asking to  speak with them tonight around 7-8pm eastern 
> time. To see if  they can contact me. They lived a long and 
> wonderful life  together. So all my family is sad to see him go, but 
> we know it  was his time to leave, and life goes on. He should be 
> happy to  be back with his wife. (He was 83 years old) I know 
> probaly  somebody here might think this is crazy, dumb or 
> disrespectful,  but that is my business. I think it should be easy to 
> get in  contact with him since he just crossed over. Please let me 
> know  if you tried and any evidence you might get from him.
> 
>  Thanks
> 
> William Rees
>
